title: Experience Profile

title: What does Career Services do?
summary:
Career Services offers help with all things career and employment, from career planning to job search help, resume support, and more. 

	This short video explains a bit more about what Career Services does:

title: How do I find a job?
summary:
You can book an appointment with a Career Advisor to get help with your job search, career planning, and developing your resume. 
You can also access resources about job search and more at the Career Services page on the Student Success Portal.

title: I want to work while I’m studying at Conestoga – how can I find a job?
summary: When looking for work, it is important to find something that will allow you to prioritize your studies. Even if you can work full-time hours (35+ hours per week) you should apply to part-time jobs as these types of jobs usually have flexible schedules. Please be mindful of the hours that you work; succeeding in your studies should be your top...

title: How can I get help with my resume?
summary:
Current students are encouraged to book an appointment with a Career Advisor for help with their resume. 
Career Services also offers workshops and resume resources. Please visit the Career Services page for more information.
